website_summaries.verdict: Whether you are a Fire fan or simply want a responsive OS with gorgeous image quality, the HD 10 is built to impress.
pros: Features Fire's largest screen yet – 10.1-inch display with HD image
Enjoy hands-free option thanks to Alexa
Durable build plus extremely speedy apps
Dolby sound is rich and clear
cons: The downside to the size and build is that owners of previous gen Fire's may find it bulky
Mixed experiences on the battery life
Minor issues with WiFi connectivity noted

customer_reviews.title: YouTube App is blocked, FireFox and Chrome Apps are also blocked
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my wife. She tried to download other browsers (other than the one came installed), she was not able to. She also tried to download YouTube app, turns out that it was blocked as well. Now, I read that, from January 1 2018, youtube will be blocked by Google because Amazon is preventing its competitors (Google, Apple, etc.) from selling products on its website. If my wife can't use youtube, for her this product is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Nice guy

customer_reviews.title: I really like the tablet but it has one glaring issue since ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the tablet but it has one glaring issue since day one were it keeps losing wifi signal and then has to reconnect. The problem happens multiple times during the day and makes it unbearable to use. I was hoping that an update would have fixed the issue by now but no avail. I really like the tablet I think it is a great design, great price point but that one issue really ruins the whole package. I would have returned it but I threw out the package it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Malducato1

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for adults or kids!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet was purchased for my daughter. Being able to set different profiles and block/monitor what she is able to do on the tablet is great. She loves it. It is big enough to watch a movie with her cousins during car rides. Great product and very well built.
customer_reviews.author: The Acostas

customer_reviews.title: The best text-to-speech for Kindle books on the planet.
customer_reviews.text: I specifically ordered this for Kindle books to be read back by Alexia. This function far exceeds my expectations! The reading is smooth and clear and relatively easy to operate. There is little documentation on how to use this powerful function but searching the internet garnered the necessary words to say. So basically any Kindle book can be played back as text to speech by Alexia. One can even change the voice from female to male and with different accents. One only needs to speak the following: "Alexia play Kindle book (and then the title)" at first I thought it wasn't working but it takes awhile to download on the first book.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Worst Charge Port!😡
customer_reviews.text: I want to know why you can’t make the charge port more sturdy????? After just a couple days of owning it the cord is now getting loose. This is the most pathetic charge port I have ever seen! The slightest bump and it will start to have issues. Total crap! FIX IT! 😡
customer_reviews.author: Secret_Shopper77

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet that will drive you crazy with Alexa spam!
customer_reviews.text: Stop bugging me with Alexa! It's a cheap tablet and that's fine. Ads all over the place are no big deal but... No more Alexa spam! Go away with this crap! If I want to activate Alexa I'll activate Alexa. I don't want to activate Alexa, ever. My best recommendation, if you choose this tablet, is to do what I did and fill the microphone opening (small opening in the center on the top edge) with epoxy so Alexa will never spy on you. You could cover the cameras with little bits of tape too if you don't use them for anything. Other than this, It's a perfectly fine tablet and works nicely. Go away Alexa and stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic amount of hardware for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Fantastic amount of hardware for the money. Con: Buying this is like Amazon becoming your parent. They want total control over what you watch and do and are constantly trying to shove you towards their preferred selections. I like Amazon but I don't want to be a branded sheep in the Amazon herd. Conclusion: Worth it if you are willing and able to work around Amazon's controlling ways. For instance, I managed to install the google play store and now my options are much improved.
customer_reviews.author: Binko Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Skip the 7 and  8 inch models and the iPad, this is the tabet to get by a long shot!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't begin to tel you how many tablets I've owned over the years (ones by Samsung, Apple, Asus, Google), but for the price, this beats them all hands down (that includes the iPad and the iPad mini). Plus I got mine refurbished for $85 bucks and it was in perfect condition. The tablet is just as speedy as the iPad i have and it has an excellent screen comparable to the iPad. I also highly recommend the Silk browser. I have both Firefox and Chrome on my fire and Silk is hands down faster than both, add Adguard and it's even better. Finally after to years of tablet buying I am happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Slow and Stopped Taking A Charger After 3 Months!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is super slow. I want to love this, but it is frustratingly slow. Stopped taking a charge and it has been just 3 months! Incredible disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: DLNAO

customer_reviews.title: No longer works
customer_reviews.text: I was going to praise it but since "show mode" came out, I can't shut it down anymore. It takes forever to get to 85% power and then it starts draining again. Plus it's now getting warmer from being on all the time. Some update definitely hosed it. Update: Amazon sent a replacement. It lasted eight months. The battery won't hold a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Majorlagg

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: My 3 r old kindle works better than this thing. No speech to text feature, no device mirroring with my fire stick. Facebook app won't let me edit my comments (curser stuck in one spot). Cover only goes on one way to use the forward camera. No availability of the live help feature which i loved. Customer support less then helpful, all she did was repeat what was written in the help app, which wasn't helpful, why i called them. Highly not recommending buy this unit anytime soon. My last kindles battery died that's why i bought a new one.
customer_reviews.author: GARY

customer_reviews.title: The Amazon Fire HD 8 2016 & 2017 both appear to be quicker then the new Amazon Fire HD 10.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size, the quality of the screen images, and battery life. But to be very honest, I have both the current release as well as the prior year's Amazon Fire HD 8 and they both appear to be much quicker then the new HD 10. The new HD 10 boasts a quicker quad core processors and the 2gb of ram. The Silk Browser in the HD 10 is so very slow in responding. Please let me know how or why this is?. I like the tablet, but it should be a lot quicker then the older and current models. Are there updates to be available??? Please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Jabba

customer_reviews.title: BIOS Menu on Startup
customer_reviews.text: Going with three stars. It feels cheap and it appears to run a little sluggish. Also when it arrived it was in bios mode... I mean come on.
customer_reviews.author: David Belle

customer_reviews.title: Won't ever buy another Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through two of these in less than a year. They work great when they work. There are problems with the charging port. You have to be extremely careful when plugging it in and taking it out. The port will stop working and you aren't able to charge it anymore. Save your money and just get an iPad or something comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Janiegirl

customer_reviews.title: If you need a tablet to run apps, this isn't it
customer_reviews.text: I'm converting from an iPad because my wife doesn't want me to spend "that kind of money" on a new tablet. I've had this for 3-4 weeks, and while I'm impressed with the build quality, I'm still not impressed with the Fire OS or the Amazon walled garden. The breadth of apps available do not come close to either an Android or IOS tablet. Since that's why I have a tablet, this thing is disappointing. However, it isn't all bad. As a Kindle book reader it's great. It has Alexa built in, which as an Amazon household is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Bill from 336

customer_reviews.title: Nice kindle except for Alexa- she needs some updates.
customer_reviews.text: Update Jan 29, 2018 will no longer turn on. I bought to replace my 8.9inch kindle because it started freezing up. This new 10 inch works faster and better. Alexa sadly is a novel idea but her search engine seems really limited. Often she does know or cannot do a skill or task asked for. Also it is not compatible with Alexa Fire stick and other Alexa compatible or run devices. Hoping it will get better with updates.
customer_reviews.author: DeVine Farms

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't mirror to TV
customer_reviews.text: This tablet doesn't mirror to TV and they don't make a cable that allows you to connect it to a TV - something that previous Fire Tablets did. Even the tutorials say it can but after several phone calls and at least an hour with Amazon tech guys they finally acknowledged that this generation Tablet can't communicate with TV even with Fire Stick.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled by the 8.9 Fire HDX
customer_reviews.text: I like this tablet and would probably like it more if I had not owned the Kindle Fire 8.9 HDX. The cameras do not take as good pictures and video as the 8.9. Finding what I'm looking for is a pain the 8.9 was more intuitive I believe. Just trying to take a picture is hard to do. Alexa is not as helpful as you would think. Word to the wise people if you like your kindle "What ever it is" Do not let the battery die while it's in use. This is what bricked my Kindle and made me settle for something that is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Burkart

customer_reviews.title: I bought this Tablet 1-3-18 all was fine intel July 12 2018 I only have fuzz and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Tablet 1-3-18 all was fine intel July 12 2018 I only have fuzz and lines just 6 months old I am the only adult that uses this tablet no return I must send for service very disappointed in Saint Clair Shores Mi.
customer_reviews.author: PAM

customer_reviews.title: Bad as a "tablet." This is a Kindle reader that is full color and can kinda stream video. That's it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this. All I needed was something to read PDFs on and maybe check the news, email, etc. The hardware on this device is barely strong enough to read text and stream some videos. It can't really browse websites. It can't really check email. It can't really scroll through Twitter. It just lags, lags, lags.... Battery life is terrible. Screen is *very* glossy. A fingerprint magnet and hard to read. You can find Samsung tablets on sale for slightly more than this, and they don't have ridiculous ads on the lock screen.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: So Very Disappointed  with my purchase..Boo Hoo...
customer_reviews.text: I loved my table ...especially watching my Netflix shows! I watched my shows one evening two weeks ago and the following morning the screen was black! I tried plugging it into three different places with three different chargers! I spend a great deal of time in my hospital bed! I also have my Kindle that I use for game playing and different types of entertainment! I'm 82 years old and I want to be alert and keep my mind sharp! So now I'm down to my old "Faithful Kindle " that I've had for a couple of years! I can not afford another Fire HD 10 Tablet @ $149.99 . It didn't even last a year!!
customer_reviews.author: Classy Senior

customer_reviews.title: It's not me, it's you
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second 64 gig w/ special offers. The first required hard resets every 24-48 hours to function properly, and #2 is not much better. I get it - a Kindle Fire is a consumption device. But when apps don't work properly, videos won't stream, and websites won't load, I can't consume. I have had similar issues with the Fire 7 and for $50, fine. I can deal. But for just under $200, I expect a base level of performance that is not being met. FYI - I had to do a hard reset to get the Amazon app to load so I can write this review.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK as a digital reader. WAY too slow for anything else.
customer_reviews.text: I withdrew my previous one star review after customer service gave me some tips that did seem to make it tolerable, but it really is a terrible machine for anything other than reading. It is so slow, it's hard to tell if the system is trying to respond, or didn't feel the thouch screen, or what ever. Update: Would love so much to smash this thing.
customer_reviews.author: NeoPantera

customer_reviews.title: Amazon not up front about what you are purchasing so beware if you purchase at a special price!
customer_reviews.text: It’s an ok product although I purchased at a special price and it was not made clear that I would be inundated with unwanted ads every time I turn the fire 10 on, as well as during use. Absolutely annoying. Amazon said I can turn the ads off but they will charge me for the discount I received. Amazon needs to be more transparent about their discounted products.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating trying to connect to chromecast. Amazon seems intent ...
customer_reviews.text: O have literally begun to hate this device. I've decided to get a real tablet. This one is not working out. Too Frustrating trying to connect to chromecast. Amazon seems intent on locking on all things Google, to the endless frustration of their customers. Occasionally the touch screen doesn't function right. Called for assistance and had to reset the device, losing information stored on it. The funny thing is my Amazon tablet would not allow me to browse on Amazon. Tax returns are coming and I'm going to but an iPad!
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Gmail crashes, Netflix app doesn't play anything...just keeps leading for ever, if i can't use it to watch, can't use it to read emails and reply with send as feature (only in gmail), then why use it?
customer_reviews.author: Shereef

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED!!
customer_reviews.text: I received my Fire 6/11/19. This was my third fire, very happy with the 1st two. Unfortunately, I missed the return date by a couple of days. I AM SO DISAPPOINTED with this! It hangs-up in games, especially at the win, then it gets stuck! After paying to advance in games, it'll hang up once I win! It pixelates the entire screen and freezes up - enuff said! Oh, there 's more but not wasting anymore time. Grrrr!
customer_reviews.author: FLANATIVGAL

customer_reviews.title: Connects to WiFi fine but once connected I had to keep toggling WiFi ...
customer_reviews.text: Returning after two days of use. Connects to WiFi fine but once connected I had to keep toggling WiFi on and off to get webpages to load. Keys on the keyboard did not respond to touch and the screen has light leakage in the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality is DROPPING rapidly
customer_reviews.text: Been really happy with the tablet over the years, have bought about 5 of them for my kids as they have grown. The last two that I have bought, one of them within the last few months ... been having serious problems with it. It won't turn on!!! All the posts I find online say there is a simple fix, hold the power button down for 15 seconds, 20 seconds, or 40 seconds and voila ... well no voila ... I get the green lightning bolt with black screen behind it while charging, let it charge overnight but the table won't turn on. Want to return this item because I am tired of dealing with it
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last even a year!
customer_reviews.text: I would have contacted you directly, but you make it very hard to figure out how to contact you after a short time. I believe this tablet has a year warranty and evidently by what I have been reading it is a common problem that it quits charging! This was a gift for my granddaughter and her father has already done all the try this on your frequently asked questions. I would like to know how to get in contact with someone who will fix my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Landingham

customer_reviews.title: Amazon CS Failed Me For the First Time Ever
customer_reviews.text: I've been an extremely loyal customer of amazon for years - my late husband and I used to joke that we'd sold our souls to Jeff Bezos! The price dropped CONSIDERABLY within just a few days of purchase, and Amazon CS said "too bad, so sad." I'm really disgusted and disheartened... after years of telling everyone I know that they could COUNT on Amazon, that their CS would take care of their problems, and I'm left in the cold. It doesn't even matter any more if the gifted tablet makes that person happy, my heart was broken by Amazon today. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Large Tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is massive! Great screen. I use to watch you tube, facebook, Amazon shopping and Amazon prime videos. And apk movie apps. The camera leaves something to be desired but I didn't buy it to take pics. Overall great tablet. Very satisfied and well worth the money. I love Amazon and all their products.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Here's the difference between a 2015 HDX and a 2019 10" Fire
customer_reviews.text: Here's the difference in connectivity between the two units. They are both the same distance but new Fire cannot seen to locate the wifi signal. Very dissapointing! I will NEVER BUY ANOTHER KINDLE AGAIN! As much as i dislike the iPad, I'll be getting one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Machikoneko

customer_reviews.title: You could pay $400 and get a Samsung with a few bells and whistles and perhaps a screen that delivers slightly better color, but to get a newlyl released device ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid high-performance android tablet. You could pay $400 and get a Samsung with a few bells and whistles and perhaps a screen that delivers slightly better color, but to get a newlyl released device with these specs for this price? It is a great deal and perfect for those who live in the Amazon/Kindle world. Have a library card? Install Overdrive and download eBooks for free. Blow up the font and it is the very best way to read. You could read all day long and your eyes will never get sore.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Bismuti

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, but nearly 50 dead/stuck pixels and subpixels in less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: Owned for less than a month, and there are nearly 50 dead/stuck pixels and subpixels. I've used it for probably less than 12 hours during that time. How does something like this even get past QA? In the first picture, I've circled every spot where I found one. The red circles are the ones I did a close-up with in the other pictures. The center one is the one with the pen tip facing right (with yellow light reflecting on the pen), the bottom left one is the one with the pen tip facing left, and the top right one is right on the edge, with the right half of the image being black.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Bad charging port and critical battery error
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second Kindle Fire 10". The first one lasted about 2 years but died due to the bad charging port problem. I got a new one as a gift for Christmas 2017, it just died (13 months after receiving) from a critical battery error. I have followed all advice to recover from this issue with no luck. I am really not happy with the idea of getting a third and have started looking for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAELA Z

customer_reviews.title: Amazon's Best Yet
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I'd ever have a tablet as nice as my Samsung Tab4 10.1. I was so wrong! My Audible books sound great. Text to voice is fantastic and improved, but still has a little difficulty in verb tense. If you have the Fire HD8 you will enjoy her big sister more. Watching HULU plus, Netflix and Amazon video is by far better than watching on a cellphone with a 5" screen. And the "price is right"!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Movies and Internet
customer_reviews.text: Great for internet use and movies. I have a Samsung Tab E as well that I use for internet and movies with bluetooth headphones. The Fire HD 10 has a slightly larger screen, better resolution and way better sound through the built in speakers than the Samsung. I don't care at all about the new Alexa capabilities and probably won't use that feature. Head to head against the next cheapest internet and movie tablet, the Samsung Tab E, this one wins hands down, especially if you only use the built in speakers. The one big negative for me was giving up the familiar Android OS on the Samsung for the somewhat awkward Amazon/Kindle OS
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Best, Most Versatile Tablet for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tablet & media player for the money! I previously had a Samsung Galaxy Tablet and like Fire HD so much better. While I have no illusions about its' capabilities & limitations, there are a few things it does very very well: * It's an outstanding media player, streaming device (Prime Video, Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, Sling, etc.) * It's virtually drop-proof / shock-proof. Durable enough for kids too. * Expandable storage for downloading movies & TV shows for watching without WiFi. * True 1080 resolution (very good screen for the money). * It's also a Kindle reader. * It's also got ALEXA. * Many more Apps are becoming available these days. * I've seen 10-12 hrs of continuous-use battery life.
customer_reviews.author: BDraper

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this kindle. This is my 3rd kindle fire, and it is not nearly as reliable as my first 2, which broke when dropped. This tablet does not keep apps loaded, like Facebook and my gaming apps that were on previous tablets and stored in the cloud. even after I have deleted in cloud and device and reloaded several times. I also have constant connectivity issues on my Wi-Fi that I don't have with other devices. Overall I am very disappointed, Alexa doesn't work even though I have followed all instructions. Videos do not play well, and will start over instead of picking up where it left off.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Good Features
customer_reviews.text: I like the price and quality of the product. My CONS are: 1. Uses SELinux security that restricts using an SD card if you add one. There is a workaround but not well advertised or understood. 2. Does not support Google Play Store directly. You have to use a 3rd party site and the ES File Explorer to add it yourself. Without some of the common Android Apps like Chrome, Office 365, etc. the product is less useful than it can be, IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: DPM

customer_reviews.title: Handy device
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's very handy for certain things, like reading e-books, listening to streamed music, or even watching streamed videos. I have prime so there's a lot of content available. It would much better if it could output that audio/video content to HDMI though. Heck, even my smart phone can do that. That cost it a star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Kindle since they first came out. My favorite was the 8 1/2 HDX Fire. It lasted four years before it wouldn't take a charge. My daughter bought me the 10" Kindle last October and it is already having trouble charging because of the plug in area. I also think the camera is not near as good as in my 8 1/2 HDX. I use my Kindle for everything and probably eight hours most days. Reading shopping, paying bills etc. Very disappointed in the 10" . I have to hold the charger in as tight as I can and lift up to get it to charge and it takes all day to charge up to 7 5%.
customer_reviews.author: glo

customer_reviews.title: Power connector Aweful
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Fire tablet and it is worse than the first. I had my first one for a year then it would not charge. I changed the power cord but still not charge. I fiddle with it and realized the sight you connect the power cord to in the tablet was not receiving the connection 95% of the time. You had to hold it just right and maybe you could get some juice. I gave up. I broke down and order a newer version and this one lasted 2 days. Will not charge. I'm done!!! done done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fire 10 tablet
customer_reviews.text: I received the tablet on time and used it for 5 days, it was wonderful. During that period I turned it on and off many times. I also ensured that the battery was always charged. On the fifth day when I tried to turn it on, no joy. Not a flicker, not a chirp. I connected the charger over night but found the pad unresponsive the next day. The end result was a return to Amazon. No questions from Amazon and a timely refund. What a shame. I really liked the tablet.
customer_reviews.author: dgeorge

customer_reviews.title: Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Average ipad/itab ... not liking the silk browser at all. I expected more. As far as the battery life, I've only had this product for 2 weeks now and the first time that I charged the pad, it never reached to 100%. ONLY got to 68% and no more. The percentage of the battery, in one sitting, will fall in the matter of minutes faster than a speeding bullet! Very frustrating I must say.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Eleazer

customer_reviews.title: I think I just got a lemon based on many of the great reviews, however I did get my monies back 👍
customer_reviews.text: Sluggish response! Even when I was shopping for Amazon products, there was a delay in loading images! So disappointing as I was trying to upgrade from my Kindle 7 that I purchased five years ago. But sadly, I find that five year old product gives me quicker response times than the brand new Kindle Fire HD 10.1. Sad, as I was hoping for an improved product! They've had long enough to produce one. There is good news! Someone in Amazon cared enough to fully refund my money spent on this product "PLUS" the money I spent on the case (or cover) that I paid!!!! Thank you Amazon customer service 👍
customer_reviews.author: Sports junkie

customer_reviews.title: Love Love
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Fire tablet and I love it. I have a 6" HD tablet from 2015, a 8" from 2016 and this year's all new 8" and a Paper White from last year. I always wanted the 10" and last month when they came out with the all new and dropped the price I didn't hesitate to pre-order. Works great, nice size to watch stuff, my collection is complete. I don't have the 7" because I have given several away as gifts when the go crazy cheap on Prime day and other sale days.
customer_reviews.author: summerblonde

customer_reviews.title: Device Won’t Charge Properly Amazon Wont Replace
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great tablet for viewing video. It is lacking in the app department as Amazon has substandard apps. Within past few months I have had problems with it charging. It takes upwards of 2 days to get charged to 30%. I have made a number of attempts via customer service to have device replaced but amazon is for some unusual reason is reluctant to replace the device. I would give device 4 stars but I have defective device that amazon won’t replace. Also, “Frank” from customer service disconnected with me earlier tonight and made no attempt to get back in touch with me.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Many Important Apps Not Available on Fire
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an over priced Kindle reader, this product is for you. There are many very popular apps on other branded tablets that are not available on Amazon, several of which I routinely use on my Samsung. Although not one important to me, Facebook is one of those unavailable. There are several very good apps for news that are free but unavailable from Amazon. The Washington Post news app is heavily promoted by Amazon which costs $4 per month, a large percentage of which goes to Amazon. So my Fire is basically used as a Kindle reader and not much else. Too bad, I had high hopes for it. Samsung's tablets are far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Originally Loved It
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy with the size of this Tablet, it was just what I needed. Shortly after getting it though there were problems with it. Amazon was very helpful in helping me return it for another one. The only problem is that it is refurbished. There have been many problems with it, but I do not want to deal with the whole return process just to receive another refurbished one, after buying and paying for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Shannyn

customer_reviews.title: Four months past replacement period, now needs replacing
customer_reviews.text: Four months after the replacement period ended, my Fire 10 suddenly wouldn’t charge. The port for the charging cable has loosened or is broken in some way, and now won’t connect to charge. I tried brand new cables that will charge my other Fire kindles, but nothing registered and the battery completely drained. This seems to be a common problem because my husband researched for a solution. Fir now, to get it to charge, it must be kept still with a prop holding it in place. Not an optimal solution. Until this problem, I was very happy with the Fire 10.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life sucks
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tablet since February and am very disappointed with it. It will not keep a charge and it will not stay connected to the internet. At first I thought it was in the cable but I tried other cables and chargers that I have and none of them will charge it fully. They charge it up to about 25% and then it starts coming down and now it will not charge at all. Very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Shull

customer_reviews.title: thought it was a great replacement for my fire 8
customer_reviews.text: my old fire 8 Died at 13 months so I got this one. OMG it died at 13 Months as well. What they do put a timer in it to break a month after the Warranty runs out? I will never buy a fire anything again!
customer_reviews.author: Ed & Kriste  DeLay

customer_reviews.title: BIG Disappointment Kindle 10
customer_reviews.text: This is my second and last Kindle. I purchased one 4 years ago and it worked for about 9 months. I thought they would have improved so I bought this "10" three weeks ago and yesterday it failed. Hopefully I can return it to??, and perhaps even get a credit or refund. Will I purchase another Kindle? NO. Would I recommend to my friends? Probably not unless they're willing to gamble. Quite disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie

customer_reviews.title: Bang meets Buck
customer_reviews.text: I've had this 64gb tablet with ads for about a week now. My needs are fairly minimal (browsing, some streaming media consumption). After sideloading Google Play store, this tablet is a great value for $120. The screen resolution and brightness are good, scrolling is smooth and snappy. I've only played around with Show Mode and it seems to be adequately responsive. The speaker volume is fine, but sound quality is on par with what you paid for the tablet (in other words, don't expect to be blown away). At this price point ($99 for 32 gb, $119 64 gb with ads), and with Google Play Store sideloaded, I'm getting similar performance to Android tablets that costs more.
customer_reviews.author: tulsudumc

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could praise, but iPad is way superior
customer_reviews.text: Although kindle fire serves the purpose, but had it been the only tablet, I would praise it...but frankly, this is light years behind iPad...anyone would be absolutely foolish to choose a kindle over iPad. For just twice the cost, the usage, power, apps , usability, hardware, cpu of iPad is way way superior than kindle...coming from an iPad world, having used it fine ver1, I felt amazon may hv produced a superior product..but..using fire seems to be super nonsense ..such a slow device...an advice, spend twice the money & get an iPad...it will last you & keep u happy for many more years.....amazon needs to improve kindle a lot
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kindle LESS THAN A YEAR AGO and it already won’t charge. I have used several different chargers to make sure it was t the charger. Seems to be the kindle. I shouldn’t be surprised tho, we have had 3 kindles and all three have ended with this same issue. NEVER AGAIN will i waste my money on a kindle fire again. Meanwhile my iPad has worked for several years. Clearly you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Davis

customer_reviews.title: Totally disappointed. Absolutely horrible
customer_reviews.text: There is a major problem with the keyboard on this new fire tablet. Number one. 1. There is no microphone for you to talk , so you have to type everything . OMG! How old school ! N 2. You are not able to see what you are typing as you type. Unbelievable. It takes about three minutes for the first letter you type to show up in the box. Beyond super slow. I am doing this message on my old Fire tablet, because I could not do it on the new one. I am definitely returning this tablet after three days, and getting my money back. I am shocked!
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent device for the money. Lots of storage, fast, flexible, and great screen and touch capabilities. And for all those reviewers that said this is an Amazon only tablet - your wrong! I installed Google Play within 2 minutes of opening the box and now I have the best of both worlds! Look up the many tutorials posted on the web. Highly recommended device with built in hands free Alexa capabilities at a bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is literally non-existent.
customer_reviews.text: What a thorough disappointment this product is. I charge it to full at night and without even using it at all, but leaving it powered on, the battery is dead by the time I go to use it for my kids 15 minutes of Mickey, Nemo, etc. before bed. I literally use it 0 minutes a day and the battery doesn't even last that long with power saver on, screen at it's dimmest, etc. It's an utter piece of garbage that I have to leave plugged into a wall to use. I haven't even had it three months and it's going it's going in the garbage because I can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheese Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is not backing up thiei
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for the first eleven months. Now, i had it on the charger that's plugged into the wall outlet that i always charge it on. It says it's charging, but in the morning still at 17%. You CANNOT get ahold of Amazon for support, it's not even a year old. You only have about two to three hours of usage before you have to charge it again. I think it should be replaced, but like i said, you can't get ahold of Amazon to discuss anything.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 2 Fire branded devices from Amazon and they've both been substandard. This tablet has a nice picture, camera is ok and battery life is ok. The downside is it has trouble staying connected to wi-fi, the operating system sucks and the touchscreen has trouble. Usually it works fine but every so often it will just stop and/or lag. It can be very frustrating. Also, the OS doesn't allow for many of the most popular game apps. Why Amazon decided to do this is beyond me but I would avoid any Fire branded devices. The build quality is sub standard and the life span is short compared to their competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Jakester

customer_reviews.title: Does not mirror
customer_reviews.text: Was told by an Amazon rep, prior to purchase, the device can mirror, it can not. That option is not available on the Fire10 7th gen. Was also told I could get apps from Google play store, this is not true.
customer_reviews.author: Burner

customer_reviews.title: Without Prime its lackluster - also no google APPS
customer_reviews.text: You can't use gmail or youtube apps. The keyboard doesn't work as well as I hoped and there is no speech to text. It is OK for web browsing and there is some non-google youtube app you can use but it's mainly designed to be used with your prime subscription and the associated streaming services. Kind wish I'd bought an android tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Commander Ticklejelly

customer_reviews.title: Poor Charging Port Design/Among Other Defects
customer_reviews.text: This product is not nearly as well made as previously owned tablets. Specifically, the charger port seems to be especially prone to loosening...which eventually prevents recharging the device. Would not recommend. Will not purchase again, unless issue is addressed satisfactorily. Amazon was “nice” enough to replace my already replaced original device, using extended warranty I that I personally paid for, with a refurbished Kindle Fire that arrived defective in yet another way. So, now I am being sent another unit with the promise that it will be free of problems. I cannot help but be skeptical about this claim. Will NEVER buy another Kindle Fire. Do not recommend this device, for fairly obvious reasons!
customer_reviews.author: XTCHR

customer_reviews.title: Its now just a paper weight 😩
customer_reviews.text: Was wonderful for 10 months. Noticed it wasn’t holding a charge so I purchased a new charger. Did not fix the issue. Just yesterday I decided to chat with Amazon support. Jag said he was sorry that trouble shooting didn’t fix the issue and informed me that I have 15% off available towards the purchase of a new fire tablet. It’s been less than a year since the original purchase date. Very sad that a repair can’t be made. I would not have purchased if I’d known it would be useless after a few months of nothing but in home use.
customer_reviews.author: Weenie

customer_reviews.title: This product is worthless and poorly constructed!
customer_reviews.text: Tablet refuses to hold charge. I am going to need to contact the company. This just started today. When you plug in the tablet the case for some reason keeps separating so there is a problem when you plug it in. This happened on my other tablet too. Am very unhappy after spending a ton of money. I can not recommend buying Amazon fire tablets any more and I have had three of them! I plan on looking into Apple products instead. This is awful when something breaks down within about two weeks of use!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Walker

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE! FAULTY CHARGING PORT
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 of these devices, one purchased in Feb 2018, and the other in April 2018.. I have already had to have both of them replaced for the same issue.. The USB charging port is CRAP! After only a couple months of use, the connection became very loose and the tablets wouldn't charge. I've used only the factory charging cords that came with the device. I've owned 6 previous versions of Fire tablets and have always been very happy with them because they were affordable, yet NOT cheaply made. It now seems that while still affordable, Amazon has gone cheap on a very vital part on the tablet. These are the last Fire tablets I will EVER buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mattman

customer_reviews.title: Limited Apps
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is a great price and for the most part its a good tablet. My issue with it is that the app store is very limited and I'm not talking about trying to use some odd ball app on the internet. These are safe apps in both the apple app store and android play store. I noticed that the tablet pushes alot of the amazon store front, which is ok but can be annoying specially if a child is using it. I wish it could be locked up and profiles be added for when my kid is on it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: That I lost money because it just died
customer_reviews.text: I bought one last year and it’s been less then a year and it died. I had to bye another one cause I use it everyday so I lost my money for the first one I bought I’m very disappointed especially cause because it ties and I had to pay again. Disappointed because I have everything ibye from amazon and am a loyal customer. I wish I would have gotten a refund. But sadly no one wanted to help me.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Dead battery after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Battery will no longer charge. I have had this only a year and a half. Have tried everything, new charger, different outlets, hard reboot and nothing 6/30/19: after talking with Amazon about the charging issue, I have changed my rating to 1 star. They are absolutely not willing to provide any compensation because I am 6 months beyond the warranty. Many have had same issue with charging problem with these tablets, so must be a manufacturing defect of some sort. I think my next tablet will be an Apple!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn M.

customer_reviews.title: Not Google app. compatable
customer_reviews.text: Over all I like the tablet but there are several things I don't like. Several apps for android will not work with it including my Norton mobile security and the HSN app. The Norton will not even install and the HSN app will install fine but once you close it, it will not open again witch is funny because I got it from HSN. I have tried to down load a couple of other Google apps that work just fine on my phones but they don't work either which is also funny because they are both android. If it is android all android apps. should work!
customer_reviews.author: Clifton A. Butcher

customer_reviews.title: 70% max battery
customer_reviews.text: Immediately upon receiving this product, it never charged greater than 70%. I even purchased new cables to troubleshoot and it still has the same issue. You also have to pay a $15 fee if you want to get rid of ads that always appear on your lock screen. This is a fee they don't tell you about until you receive the tablet and notice 10" of ads in your face every time you turn on your screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mine was defective...
customer_reviews.text: The tablet will not stay charged at all it stays at 1% most of the time. If you let it charge for a long time and go to use it the battery drains really fast. Now my mom has one and she loves it and has had no problems. My son has the 7 inch fire and hes had it for 2 years now and it still works great. I just happened to get a detective tablet. Thats why I gave 3 stars. Otherwise I would have given 5 because Ive had good experience with these tablets in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Michael and Ashley

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for - avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this tablet. The camera quality was extremely poor and grainy. I ordered this tablet to be able to utilize the Alexa program, however, without a smart phone to link it to you can't do video calls. Well, if I had a smart phone, I wouldn't need the tablet. I guess it will be OK for watching videos...but that's about it. Yeehaw, I sold a piece of my soul to Amazon (to set this tablet up with email and other options, you have to give Amazon full access to everything on the tablet - no privacy) and got nothing in return. Pass on this purchase, it's not worth it, even at the discounted price.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Loses internet connection
customer_reviews.text: Have 8.9 HDX. Found it's no longer available so this looked like the next best thing. But seriously, is this as good as it gets? Very disappointed so far. Frequently drops internet, although my HDX is still connected. I can't understand this move by Amazon to downgrade the Fire like this! May end up returning and trying something else. Very disappointed, @Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: W. Cain

customer_reviews.title: Fire HD Tablet defects
customer_reviews.text: Delivery of my 1st purchase resulted in a return. The screen had light lines running through all images. I sent it back and received a refurbished tablet. The refurbished tablet won’t hold a charge on the battery so I have used it very little. Now it won’t read the WiFi signals in my house. Sending back for another repair and or another refurbished replacement. I feel like I should just receive a new product for the one I never had. Amazon is good about fixing and replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Martin

customer_reviews.title: A great boost of hardware
customer_reviews.text: While no tablet on earth can compete with Fire HD series in terms of cost efficiency, I've always felt lack of performance. I wanted it to be 'a little bit better' for probably '10~30' more dollars. I've also been disappointed by Amazon's pseudo-upgrade on Fire HD 8 models (the 2016 and 2017 versions are basically the same in terms of performance!!!) This is why I'm so happy with the boost in hardware for this new Fire HD 10. It added a spoon of sugar into bitter-tasting cappuccino. I don't experience bothersome lagging anymore. And yet the godlike cost-efficiency has not changed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner :D

customer_reviews.title: Many APPS not available.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy with this at all. Many apps I use can't be downloaded onto this which makes it more worthless than convenient. For a quad core it was slow. Every time I attempt to download, downloading to my kindle is not an option. I am only given an option for a cell phone. This is turning into a $150 paperweight. I can't even download the browser I need to play my online game (Puffin) and it's an android based apps. I thought this would be a better option for travelling. I was severely mistaken. I should have bought a real android tablet!
customer_reviews.author: Sneaker411

customer_reviews.title: New kindle products do not last anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Fire HD 10.1 Lasted 19 months. Dead will not charge. Bought a second one from QVC because of good price. Had to send it back. Charges when it wants to. I had a Kindle reader, one of the first ones, my grand daughter is still using it. Also the first Kindle Fire, daughter-in-law still using. Now two, one 19 months and one not a year old and acting up. Amazon should be better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The power ports keep failing
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Kindle in 1 year. My family all have them after time the power port won't hold the charging cord...bought over 6 chargers and eventually they all failed. I contacted Amazon about this issue and their response was: we'll contact the manufacturer! Planned obsolescence appears to be the issue, and Amazon's failure to correct a known problem.Amazon has contacted me to review this issue...LOL
customer_reviews.author: Mary O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet does exactly what I want. I watch movies. I read books via the kindle application. I read the newspaper. I surf the internet. I have not added additional memory yet. The 10 inch screen is perfect. The speakers are good. The tablet is lightweight but feels sturdy. I like the price. The Amazon video interface is easy to navigate. I also purchased the MoKo Case for All-New Amazon Fire HD 10 Tablet and the All-New Fire HD 10 Screen Protector [2-Pack]. I use my tablet daily for reading mostly.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: 100% Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Do not, I repeat, DO NOT purchase any Kindle Fires, as they are made very badly and the charging port dies and there is nothing you can do to fix it. Mine, my sister’s, and my niece’s all broke AT THE SAME TIME, two months after the warranty expired. Customer service had the gall to offer me 15% off a new kindle, as if I would ever throw my money in the trash again. Do not buy Kindle Fire, it is a shitty product.
customer_reviews.author: Lamski

customer_reviews.title: Front and back Cameras are both Grainy
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality of displayed items is high def quality except images capture on the front or back cameras. I have been using cameras since Grade School in the 40's and use high quality Nikon and Canon units for everyday shooting. My Ipad recently acquired captues in high def quality and points out the lame deficiency of the Amazon Fire front and back lenses. I injured a foot about the time the Fire was bought, underwent major surgery and haven't been able until recently to assses the Fire problem please advise repair or replacement. J R Bachtel. 12/19/18
customer_reviews.author: John R. Bachtel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here. It is an incredible value for the cost. Very responsive, good display, fast tablet. It is geared toward Amazon content but it is relatively easy to side load applications and even install the Google store if you so choose. My specific use of a tablet is for digital content such as web access, digital books, and videos. I find it to be an outstanding value. Supports micro SD card for storage expansion. I'm currently using a 64 GB micro SD card. There are high end Samsung Galaxy tablets and iPads in my household and I find this tablet to be just as capable at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Madscientist

customer_reviews.title: Just enjoying how easy it is to use.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my new Fire HD tablet, with hands free Alexa. The print is so clear on my Kindle and as I only have one eye that works the size is important to me and I can regulate it so it is great. I still have the original Kindle whichIkeep in my bedroom as well as another Kindle Fire so I am fixed for life with book reading pieces. I love listening to my music while I am cooking. I guess I cannot say enough wonderful things about Amazon and my Kindles as well as everything else I purchse from Amazon with my Prime account.
customer_reviews.author: judi whelan

customer_reviews.title: No Display Mirroring???
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fire HD 10 Tablet. I take my other HD10 everywhere I go. However, the 7th generation HD10 does not include Display Mirroring which I use all the time. I don't understand why this was taken out of the Fire tablet unless it is to sell the Amazon smart televisions. Amazon Prime and Netflix don't always have the movies I like so I watch the ones I have bought by mirroring them to my tv. I can already use Alexa on my other HD 10 so there wasn't much reason to keep this tablet. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: I ♥ this new Kindle! For so many reason!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet so much and if you have prime music or video Alexa is awesome. The size is perfect for me but I am 46 and my eyes want things bigger now. I love this size and all the new features! Its like holding a hardback book to me but I can adjust the font size and color of the screen. I have owned every Kindle from the beginning and if you like Kindles you will like this one unless you dont want to feel like you're holding a large hardback lightweight book.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Wood

customer_reviews.title: No Difference between this and my ipad pro. I feel ripped off by $600 now. Sorry Apple
customer_reviews.text: Would have rated it 5/5 if I didn't have to find a cheat way to download google play. I bought this for my son to play games, movies, and do his homework on the Google service (word, slideshow,...etc) that his school requires him to do. Forced downloaded google play and this thing was rockin. I wish I didn't pay $800 for my ipad pro. This thing is as quick and as durable feeling as my ipad pro. The screen quality between the ipad and the fire HD 10 was not noticeable. Both were crystal clear, no blurry motion, rich in color. I Really got ripped off by $600 by buying my ipad.
customer_reviews.author: John Mackerell

customer_reviews.title: Love the size, ease of using, but hate that it cuts out on Wi-Fi!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to really grade this. I find it loses wifi signal all the time. This frustrated me, especially when I'm in the middle of reading something, or typing something, and poof, screen goes black and you have start over. It's not the signal, it's the fire HD10, I don't have that problem on my two 8's. Update. Within minutes of my review, I was called by customer service. They are sending out a new kindle. I love Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: STEER CLEAR
customer_reviews.text: For those who have IPADs or Apple products, do not buy. Have several iPads, bought this one for my 3 year old because of price. Thought it would have similar performance and use. You might as well buy an imitation iPad from China in some back alleyway, you would probably be better off. I truly don’t understand how this has over 1 stars. For those who are looking for a tablet, steer clear, this be a 50$ disposable piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 devices - same problem - design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Fire 10 tablet that we have gone through. Our purchase date is 2018, when we bought multiple devices at the same time because they were a special deal and cost next to nothing. However, we did not open a new device until we needed it. Thankfully, we did purchase multiple devices because each device only lasted about 6-8 months. Each time was the same problem...the charging port. Mind you, they were used by kids (ages 6-9), but for each device to fall short and not be able to be used for the same reason is definitely a product flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Slow and clunky with poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a year now and to be honest it mostly stays in the cupboard in favor of a 4 year old Samsung Galaxy tab which is still faster and has a much nicer screen. If it wasn't for the fading battery on that tablet I'd have returned this one but even with the fading battery it still lasts longer when not actively in use. The Fire is frustrating to use because apps are slow to open and the battery drains quickly when you're not actively using it so it's flat the next time you need it. Do yourself a favor and pay a bit more for a faster, better optimized tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Bart W

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet locked down to Amazon only.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet itself is a marvel for the money. The screen is bright, clear, and a pleasure to watch. Speakers, while not spectacular, are perfectly usable. Speed is fine for any media consumption, and battery life is excellent. The problem is Amazon. They purposely break this tablets ability to run normal Android apps, and there is just not enough in the Amazon walled garden. I left Apple for exactly this kind of behavior. If you are so inclined, adding Google apps to this tablet can be done, and it can be rooted without much difficulty, but fighting with the manufacturer for control of what I paid for is a huge negative in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Goldenu

customer_reviews.title: ::CAUTION:: Read Reviews Prior To Purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Please familiarize yourself with what features this device doesn't provide, what it doesn't allow such as Mirroring / Casting and using browsers other than Silk- Understand that it has bugs, glitches, takes quite a while to charge, that the battery gets very hot while charging and then drains rapidly when in use- Bottom line: One/Two Star Device-
customer_reviews.author: County Line

customer_reviews.title: Missing a key feature
customer_reviews.text: Every device I have owned has the ability to screen cast to a firetv stick. Except the Fire Tablet 10" I live in a remote area with limited wifi so I can't stream movies. So, I download them when I can. I can screen cast movies with my android phone and tablet but there is no way to screen cast from the Fire Tablet without using wifi. Defeats my whole purpose. No problem using my android tablet to screen cast to a firestick using the LAN but Fire Tablet will only cast using wifi. Won't recommend it to anyone or buy another until I can screencast a Fire Tablet to a firestick.
customer_reviews.author: Ed O

customer_reviews.title: For HD Fire 10"
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. A cheap tablet with a fancy screen. This thing lags constantly and with only one app running. Display looks nice but that's only when it isn't freezing. Not that it can't play a video straight through, it lags during general use. Sometimes crashing. I got the version with ads which the ads don't bother me. What does is the fact that occasionally it can become frozen on the ad screen before I can unlock it and the only way to fix is to restart it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Functional but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product to use for studying so I didn't have to sit with a full laptop. The product is functional and I can access the study materials through the internet browser. However, I expected to be able to download the same apps as my phone but not all are available. Also, it lags. When going from app to app or to the home page, there's a little bit of a lag. The camera doesn't have a flash and notifications continue to pop up even after they are cleared. Not sure if some of this is user error but I consider myself pretty tech savvy. So, there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H

customer_reviews.title: Glitch Filled Problem
customer_reviews.text: I've owned three Amazon tablets and numerous others, and I will say that the Amazon tablets are FILLED with glitches and empty promises. Constantly needs restarting or numerous functions won't work properly or at all. Completely USELESS help function that promises online chat (which doesn't work), email help that always wants you to call them for every problem, and the inevitable "your tablet may be defective" solution and an offer to sell you another tablet at a discount of 25% off - Why would you want another one ?!? Apparently this is Amazon's idea of Customer Service. !! NEVER AGAIN !!
customer_reviews.author: ScorpioTgr

product_meta.title: Fire HD 10 Tablet with Alexa Hands-Free, 10.1" 1080p Full HD Display, 64 GB, Black (Previous Generation - 7th)
feature_bullets: Brilliant 10.1" 1080p Full HD display (1920 x 1200), up to 1.8 GHZ quad-core processor, 2 GB RAM, and up to 10 hours of battery life.

Our largest display, now with over 2 million pixels, stereo speakers, Dolby Audio, and dual-band 802.11ac Wi-Fi—perfect for watching Full HD video, playing games, reading magazines, and streaming content seamlessly
Use Alexa hands-free mode to pause videos, play music, open apps, show sports scores, display the weather, and more—just ask
Call or message almost anyone hands-free, or make video calls to family and friends with a Fire tablet, Echo Spot, Echo Show, or the Alexa App. Instantly connect to enabled Echo devices.
32 or 64 GB internal storage expandable by up to 256 GB (using the microSD slot). Watch downloaded videos anywhere with a Prime membership, Netflix plan, or Showtime subscription.
Enjoy millions of movies, TV shows, songs, Kindle eBooks, magazines, Android apps, and games—including Netflix, Facebook, HBO, Spotify, and more
Prime members get unlimited access to over a thousand books and magazines, millions of songs, and thousands of movies and TV episodes—at no additional cost
